message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SD, cs.HC. 

This paper deals with the task of recognizing emotions and dialogue acts in conversational analysis, which is a common topic in the field of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper proposes the use of recurrent neural models, which are a popular type of machine learning model in NLP, and ensemble learning, which is a common technique in machine learning. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Learning) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also involves analyzing the co-occurrence of emotion and dialogue act labels, which is related to data mining and statistical analysis, making cs.SD (Sound) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the potential applications of the proposed method in building natural dialogue systems, which is related to human-computer interaction, making cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) a possible sub-category as well.
